titlestmt.titleproper: Partial inventory of the James F. Tent papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-02-13T09:43-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Incremental materials added to finding aid and collection title updated based on Searchworks record by Sarah Patton.
Updated to include new increment and additional description.

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, memoranda, studies, minutes, conference proceedings, and interview transcripts relating to educational policy and denazification in the American-occupied zone of Germany after World War II, the establishment of the Freie Universität Berlin, and Nazi persecution of persons of partial Jewish ancestry. Includes photocopies of records of the Education and Cultural Relations Division of the United States Office of Military Government for Germany, 1945-1949, and photocopies of Nazi police files. Used as research material for J. F. Tent's books Mission on the Rhine: Reeducation and Denazification in American-Occupied Germany (Chicago, 1982), The Free University of Berlin (Bloomington, 1988), and In the Shadow of the Holocaust: Nazi Persecution of Jewish-Christian Germans (Lawrence, 2003).

origination.label: Contributor
origination.corpname: Germany (Territory under Allied occupation, 1945-1955 : U.S. Zone) Office of Military Government. Education and Cultural Relations Division

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], James F. Tent papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1986, with an increment received in 2016.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

originalsloc.head: Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: In part, originals at the National Archives, Washington, D.C.

eventgrp.event: Published master's thesis, German Social Democracy and the General Strike, 1890-1914
Received master's degree from the University of Wisconsin
Published dissertation, Eugen Richter, Manchester Liberal and German Statesman
Received PhD from the University of Wisconsin

chronitem.event: Began teaching New European history, German history, military history, and the history of the Cold War at the University of Alabama at Birmingham
Served as the Dean of the History Department at the University of Alabama at Birmingham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The James F. Tent papers consist of correspondence, reports, memoranda, studies, minutes, conference proceedings, and interview transcripts relating to educational policy and denazification in the American-occupied zone of Germany after World War II, the establishment of the Freie Universität Berlin, and Nazi persecution of persons of partial Jewish ancestry. Includes photocopies of records of the Education and Cultural Relations Division of the United States Office of Military Government for Germany, 1945-1949, and photocopies of Nazi police files. Used as research material for J. F. Tent's books Mission on the Rhine: Reeducation and Denazification in American-Occupied Germany (Chicago, 1982), The Free University of Berlin (Bloomington, 1988), and In the Shadow of the Holocaust: Nazi Persecution of Jewish-Christian Germans (Lawrence, 2003).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes copies of Nazi police files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes lists of known Nazis at German universities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In addition to titled reports beginning with the letter "U," these folders also contains excerpts and untitled reports.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains speeches, essays, radio broadcasts, and other writings not authored by James F. Tent but by multiple miscellaneous people.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains resumes, faxes, revisions, notes, and other printed matter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence files relating to a variety of topics but pertaining mostly to Tent's research in German history and his academic career.
